issues.description: The solution adds an extra 'age' attribute to Animal and requires two-argument constructors (String name, int age) for Animal and all concrete animals (Seal, Pig, Goat). The problem statement and UML specify only a name attribute for Animal and imply single-argument constructors (name). The template's Main (commented example) also instantiates Seal/Pig/Goat with a single String argument (e.g., new Seal("Clarabelle")). This mismatch means the solution's constructors and fields are structurally incompatible with the problem description and the template's example usage, and would prevent students from using the provided Main or from following the specified design without modification.
issues.suggested_fix:
Align the constructor signatures and attributes between problem, template, and solution. Two options:
1) Prefer minimal change to match the problem statement: remove the 'age' field from Animal and change Animal and all concrete animal constructors to accept only String name (update solution accordingly). Update any getters/setters in the solution to remove age. This keeps the template Main valid and matches the UML and task description.
2) If age is intended to be part of the design, update the problem statement/UML and the template Main to document and use two-argument constructors (String name, int age). Explicitly list 'age' as an attribute in the UML and in the tasks so students know to implement it.
